description: '''Turbo-folk''' is a subgenre of contemporary [[South Slavs|South Slavic]] pop music that initially developed in [[Serbia]] during the 1990s as a fusion of [[techno]] and [[folk music|folk]]. The term was an invention of the [[Montenegro|Montenegrin]] singer [[Rambo Amadeus]], who jokingly described the aggressive, satirical style of music as "turbo folk". While primarily associated with Serbia, this style is also popular in other former Yugoslav republics.
